intro: Crepidorhopalon tenuifolius, commonly known as the slender-leaved crepidorhopalon, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
